title: Grayfox (How do I have Riot make a Champion upon request?)
body:
Riot, how do i catch your attention to create a champion i'd like. I'm reaching out to the gods for answers, i need to make Grayfox a character...
If one does not agree with this, Give me reasons instead of hitting the "downvote" button plz. I'd like input on how to make my idea better.


Grayfox, The Cyborg Ninja

Role:
Melee, Tank, carry.

Quote:

Grayfox is a melee ad/ap damage carry, that causes damage and is defensive, if his ultimate is on the full charge. He goes invisible, gains movement speed, attack speed and his damage is increased by 40 + 15% of AD.

Lore:
Unknown Lore.

Stats:

Health 780 (+70)
Health regen. 4.5 (+0.9)
Mana 300 (+8.5)
Mana regen. 6.2 (+0.9)
Range 450
Attack damage 80 (+8,5)
Attack speed 0.725 (+1.54%)
Armor 50 (+7)
Magic res. 38 (+7)
Mov. speed 350

Quote:

Skills:

Unique passive ability - "Unknown Force"
Each dash grants 15+ movement speed, accumulative up to max 3 dashes
Lasts 15 sec per dash decreasing each second as time passes. Increases passive damage by 15+ per strike

[Q] - "Transmission Strike"
Grayfox slices a wave in front of him. Hold to toss sword and stab target teleporting to target. (Tap to strike) (Hold to teleport strike)
Cooldown: 10/9/8/7/6 seconds.
Cost: 0 Mana
Range: 1100

[W] - "Electromagnetic Barrier"
Grayfox creates a magical shield around himself that absorbs 100/120/160/200/240/280 (+0,55 AP)incoming damage. Lasts 5 sec.
When the shield is active Grayfox reflects 15/20/25/30/35% incoming physical and magic damage
Cooldown: 15/14/13/12/10 seconds.
Cost: 0 Mana

[E] - «Ethereal Dash"
Passive:
Increases the critical strike chance of Grayfox.
When activated:
Dashes through target. Grayfox gets 3 dashes total.
Cooldown: 6/5/4.5/3.5/2.5 seconds.
Cost: 45 | 50 | 60 | 70 | 80 Mana

[R](Ultimate) - "Unknown Entity"
Grayfox begins to phase and creates afterimages and begins to go invisible. His Movement speed is increased by 50 and Attack Speed is increased by 45%. Attack damage is increased by 40 + 15% of AD.
Cooldown: 135/110/100 seconds.
Cost: 150 Mana
Range: Self/Global

replies.body:
So, right off the bat, Riot does not crowdsource or outsource champion concepts. Ultimately, if you're not making your champion idea for your own entertainment, there isn't too much of a reason to. I know that sucks to hear, but it's the truth.

Secondly, a cyborg ninja -- let along one that's pulled from another franchise -- is not something that seems like a good fit for League. While both cyborgs and ninja have a place in *League*, combining the two seems a bit odd, as it's a Zaun/Ionia hybrid that feels somewhat out of sorts with the world.

Finally, while I could give you a full kit breakdown, I feel this kit suffers a lot from two common issues I see frequently. First off is virtually mirroring another character from another game (Genji, in this case) almost perfectly, and second is a tendency to use added movement or passive stat boosts in place of interesting or engaging gameplay. Aside from the Q, this character is *extremely* straightforward and stat-checky, yet also manages to be extremely frustrating due to virtually non-stop mobility.

Gods have spoken.
and it's meant to be out of the ordinary, He has an unknown origin/story.
What more creative could you want?

> [{quoted}](name=Grayfox100,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=BkKwPH1q,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-01-02T05:13:08.678+0000)and it's meant to be out of the ordinary, He has an unknown origin/story.

The problem with "out of the ordinary" is that there are ways that's great, and ways it isn't great. A sentient sink with a slingshot is out of the ordinary, but I think we both agree it's a bad fit for *League*. If you want to sell a cyborg ninja, I'd want to see a good origin/story that convinces me that it fits into the *League* world, rather than just throwing it in willy-nilly.

> What more creative could you want?

If you're legitimately asking the question, I'd want two main things:

* A unique character with a better defined story, as story/character are what players love, and this feels like "mysterious cyborg who is basically Genji and has a name/theme from Metal Gear." I'd much rather see a character who stands on his/her own as a unique addition to the League world.
* A kit that relies less on easily-accessible mobility and stat-boosts in favor of more interesting interactions or mechanics that are bigger tests of player skill. Your Q here is interesting -- a skillshot with an optional blink is cool, and requires decision-making. The rest is all fire-and-forget abilities that just give a lot of power and/or mobility without a lot of thought or interesting interactions with either the rest of the kit OR with the enemy play patterns.

See if you're really getting to know me... This is where i lack and need medicine for. It's called Psychosis and a brainfog. (which clouds my creativity). I wish i could answer this any other way but you got me beat here.
My goal was to make a Yasuo/Kayn like champ btw.

If the concept had something that added a new mechanic then maybe, but so far it's only kinda half his Q and that doesn't add enough to make him feel like his own unique champion.

Rito is working toward making all their "brain-dead" champions, like Warwick used to be, into more interesting unique champions. So they would not opt to add in a champion who doesn't add versatility into the League. Let alone a champion specifically designed to mirror another character.

Just because they don't have something isn't a reason for them to add it. League also doesn't have a worm champion, and League shouldn't have a worm. Well... Potentially a weird worm thing... Maybe... Hold that thought.
How? You don't. In fact, Riot specifically avoids looking at champ concepts, so that they stay far away from the mess of figuring out who owns those concepts.
Not only is it a gross memepost but that stuff belongs to Konami.

Look at Overwatch with Genji. If they can have a Cyborg Ninja and Metal Gear can make one. Why not make one for League? He would have afterimages(which would be new) and teleports like Kassadin. I'm not saying make the same character but one just kinda like Kayn but you know a op cyborg.
